items.headline: Bitcoin firm backed by Trump brothers jumps 110% in debut before pulling back. Is it a buy?
items.summary_en: Shares of American Bitcoin, a bitcoin mining and treasury company backed by President Donald Trump’s two eldest sons, surged as much as 110% on Wednesday before pulling back in its first day of trading after completing a merger with Nasdaq-listed Gryphon Digital Mining.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: American Eagle says Sydney Sweeney ad campaign ‘is not going anywhere’ after uptick in demand
items.summary_en: Shares of American Eagle soared on Wednesday after the clothing retailer forecast same-store sales that were better than expected, and said recent promotional campaigns starring actress Sydney Sweeney and NFL player Travis Kelce had boosted fall-season demand.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Figma’s revenue jumps 41%, but that’s not enough to lift the stock
items.summary_en: Figma’s stock dropped more than 14% after hours after the company merely met Wall Street’s expectations for second-quarter revenue.

items.headline: Fed officials struggle to explain slowing economy, adding to the sense a rate cut is coming
items.summary_en: “I don’t see a recession in my forecast at all, but I do see slower growth through the year,” said Fed governor Christopher Waller, in an interview on CNBC.
